learningMode.title: Learning Mode
learningMode.noActiveSession: No active learning session. Start one to begin guided learning.

startDialog.title: Start Learning Session
startDialog.description: Define what you want to learn. The AI mentor will guide you through step-by-step discovery using the Socratic method.
startDialog.topic: What do you want to learn?
startDialog.topicPlaceholder: e.g., How does recursion work in programming?
startDialog.backgroundPlaceholder: Describe your current understanding of this topic...
startDialog.goalHint: Press Enter to add a goal
startDialog.journeyHint: Systematic learning creates a learning path with milestones and progress tracking

learningType.quickDesc: Ask a question, get an answer
learningType.journeyDesc: Create a learning path, track progress

dashboard.noActivePathsDesc: Start a systematic learning plan to track your progress

stats.engagementHigh: You're highly engaged! Keep it up!
stats.engagementLow: Try to stay engaged with the material.

page.title: Speed Learning
page.subtitle: Smart textbook learning · Efficient exam prep

rapid.title: Rapid Mode
rapid.description: 1-2 hours to master core exam points

intensive.title: Intensive Mode
intensive.description: 2-4 hours systematic study of key content

comprehensive.title: Comprehensive Mode
comprehensive.description: 6-12 hours in-depth study of all content

page.textbooksDesc: Manage your textbooks and learning materials
page.uploadPdfOrAdd: Upload PDF textbook or add online textbook
page.tutorialsDesc: Speed learning tutorials based on textbooks
page.addTextbookFirst: Add textbook first, then generate speed tutorials
page.selectFromExamples: Select from textbook examples and exercises
page.wrongQuestionsAutoRecord: Wrong answers will be recorded automatically
page.analyticsDesc: View learning data and progress trends

notes.title: Learning Notes
notes.placeholder: Write a note about what you've learned...
notes.empty: No notes yet. Start taking notes to remember key insights!

history.noSessions: No completed sessions yet. Start learning to track your progress!

visualization.title: Concept Visualization
visualization.clickToExplore: Click on a node to explore details

transformer.title: Transformer Architecture
transformer.description: Click on components to learn more, or use the controls to animate the data flow.

inputEmbedding.name: Input Embedding
inputEmbedding.description: Converts input tokens to dense vectors
inputEmbedding.details: Each token in the input sequence is mapped to a d-model dimensional vector using a learned embedding matrix. This transforms discrete tokens into a continuous vector space.

positionalEncoding.name: Positional Encoding
positionalEncoding.details: Since the Transformer has no inherent notion of sequence order, positional encodings are added to give the model information about token positions.

multiHeadAttention.name: Multi-Head Attention
multiHeadAttention.details: The core mechanism of Transformers. Computes attention weights to determine how much each token should attend to every other token. Multiple heads learn different relationship patterns.

addNorm.name: Add & Normalize
addNorm.details: Adds the input back to the output (residual connection) and applies layer normalization. This helps with gradient flow and training stability.

feedForward.name: Feed-Forward Network
feedForward.details: A simple two-layer neural network applied to each position independently. Typically expands the dimension by 4x and then projects back.

encoder.name: Encoder Stack
encoder.details: The encoder processes the input sequence and creates representations that capture the meaning and relationships within the input. Typically consists of N=6 identical layers.

decoder.name: Decoder Stack
decoder.details: The decoder generates the output sequence one token at a time, attending to both the encoder output and previously generated tokens. Also consists of N=6 identical layers.

outputLinear.name: Linear Projection
outputLinear.details: A linear transformation that maps the decoder output to the vocabulary dimension, producing logits for each possible token.

softmax.name: Softmax
softmax.details: Applies the softmax function to convert raw logits into a probability distribution over the vocabulary.

inputProcessing.title: Input Processing
inputProcessing.description: The input sequence is first converted to embeddings and combined with positional encodings.
inputProcessing.highlight: The sequence "Hello, world!" is tokenized and converted to vectors.

selfAttention.title: Self-Attention
selfAttention.description: Each token computes attention over all other tokens to understand context and relationships.
selfAttention.highlight: The word "world" attends to "Hello" to understand the greeting context.

residualNorm1.title: Residual & Normalize
residualNorm1.description: The attention output is added back to the input (residual connection) and normalized.

feedForward.title: Feed-Forward Processing
feedForward.description: Each position is processed independently through a feed-forward network.
feedForward.highlight: This adds non-linear transformations to the representations.

residualNorm2.title: Second Residual & Normalize
residualNorm2.description: Another residual connection and normalization completes one encoder layer.

fullEncoder.title: Full Encoder
fullEncoder.description: The complete encoder stack processes the input through N identical layers.
fullEncoder.highlight: Typically N=6 layers, each with attention and feed-forward sublayers.

decoderProcessing.title: Decoder Processing
decoderProcessing.description: The decoder generates output tokens, attending to both encoder output and previous tokens.
decoderProcessing.highlight: Uses masked attention to prevent looking at future tokens.

outputGeneration.title: Output Generation
outputGeneration.description: The final output is projected to vocabulary size and converted to probabilities.
outputGeneration.highlight: The highest probability token is selected as the next output.

academic.title: Academic Research
academic.description: Search, manage, and analyze academic papers

knowledgeMap.title: Knowledge Map

createDialog.title: Create Knowledge Map
createDialog.description: Create a new knowledge map from content or PDF

knowledgeMap.selectTrace: Select a trace to view details
knowledgeMap.selectOrCreate: Select a knowledge map from the list or create a new one

deleteConfirm.title: Delete Knowledge Map
deleteConfirm.description: Are you sure you want to delete this knowledge map? This action cannot be undone.

chatPanel.title: Academic Research Assistant
chatPanel.placeholder: Search for papers or ask a research question...

citationGraph.title: Citation Network
citationGraph.emptyState: Select a paper to view its citation network
citationGraph.emptyStateHint: Citations and references will appear here

paperComparison.title: Paper Comparison
paperComparison.description: Compare up to 4 papers side by side
paperComparison.emptyStateHint: Select papers from your library to compare them side by side

paperSearch.placeholder: Search papers by title, author, or keywords...
paperSearch.noResults: No papers found. Try adjusting your search or filters.
paperSearch.emptyState: Search for academic papers across multiple sources
paperSearch.emptyStateHint: Supports arXiv, Semantic Scholar, CORE, and more

paperRecommendations.title: Recommendations
paperRecommendations.description: Discover papers based on your library
paperRecommendations.emptyStateHint: Add more papers to your library or search for papers

smartCollections.title: Smart Collections
smartCollections.description: Auto-organize papers based on rules and topics
smartCollections.noTopicsHint: Add more papers to detect common topics

howItWorksSteps.step1: Enable the rules you want to use
howItWorksSteps.step3: Papers will be automatically added based on criteria
howItWorksSteps.step4: Topic collections are created from common fields

paperDetail.notesPlaceholder: Add your notes about this paper...
paperDetail.analyzeHint: Click 'Analyze' to get AI-powered insights about this paper

paperLibrary.createCollectionDescription: Create a new collection to organize your papers
paperLibrary.emptyStateHint: Search and add papers to get started

flowChat.emptyCanvasHint: Your messages will appear as nodes on this canvas
flowChat.createBranchHint: Create a new conversation branch from this point
flowChat.dropNodesToGroup: Drag nodes here to add to group
